content: We highly recommend that you use the Connectathon Manager tool provided by David Hay, however - if you are more comfortable with the traditional tracking spreadsheet you may use the one located here: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ZgcdZ-iNEMFaztuND5EHSxyQP8M4GUbmKmEN6XzQtNU/edit#gid=1088922430
Is there an updated link to the Connectathon Manager tool?
@Jenni Syed : David is setting it up - see the 'sign up sheet' thread

So here's the link to conman (btw - stands for 'connectathon Manager' - it's been said I have a twisted sense of humour.) Right now there are no tracks entered - Track Leads: here's a link to the setup instructions: https://fhirblog.com/configuring-conman/ . These assume a technical connectathon - idea is that we'll use it for clinical as well...

It's fine to enter your name even before the tracks are set up - you can indicate preferences later.

I'll put stubs in for the tracks when I get a chance - but best for the track leads to do that (if you are using the tool)

Usual disclaimer: it's a work in progress - please report any bugs here and I'll do my best to sort out!
OK - have added the stubs and a link to the details page for each track.
To 'register' - simply navigate to the site. You'll get a login popup. Assuming this is the first time, then add yourself as a new user. No password required.

After registering, your name will be in the 'people' tab - you can go in there and update your details including tracks of interest (you get a single primary track and any number of tracks of interest).
If you have a server, then add it to the 'servers' tab. clients to the 'clients' tab.
feedback welcome!
Oh, and there's a high level of trust here ATM - nothing stopping you from editing other peoples details - but please don't... (unless they ask you to)
Track leads: If you are going to use the tool to track results - then add the scenarios to your track,. Doesn't need to have a lot of detail - just whatever makes sense...
Thanks David
..it does not let me enter the FHIR version of our test server, and seems to be confused by the returned XML Conformance
@David Hay ^

Hmm. It expects a JSON response (XML is more tricky in web apps) - is that feasible?
The FHIR version is coming from the capability statement - and it can't read the XML!

I can look at how to interpret XML if JSON is going to be a problem for you...

BTW - thanks for doing this now - it's great to be able to work on the issues ahead of time, rather than on the day!
JSON is supported, but you have to ask for it with either an accept header or a _format=json parameter - if nothing is specified you get XML
I am not seeing the proper link for conman for Baltimore
http://conman.fhir.org/connectathon.html?event=baltimore2018
The Client and Server tabs are visible only if you select a track - but do not appear to be track-specific

That's right - clients & servers aren't track specific - though the tabs don't show until a track (type=technical) is selected. Always room for UI improvement :)

wrt the capability statement - let me check on that. I thought I included that header, but you never know...
OK fixed - the header was incorrect.
I note that you have a number of extensions @Michele Mottini - I'm not looking at them, though they show in the json view...
Thanks David, cool
